13namespace v8 {
14namespace internal {

16// TODO(v8:14585): Reduce duplication with EPT::SweepAndCompact.
17uint32_t ExternalBufferTable::SweepAndCompact(Space* space,
18 Counters* counters) {
19 DCHECK(space->BelongsTo(this));
20 DCHECK(!space->is_internal_read_only_space());
21
22 // Lock the space. Technically this is not necessary since no other thread can
23 // allocate entries at this point, but some of the methods we call on the
24 // space assert that the lock is held.
25 base::MutexGuard guard(&space->mutex_);
26 // Same for the invalidated fields mutex.
27 base::MutexGuard invalidated_fields_guard(&space->invalidated_fields_mutex_);
28
29 // There must not be any entry allocations while the table is being swept as
30 // that would not be safe. Set the freelist to this special marker value to
31 // easily catch any violation of this requirement.
32 space->freelist_head_.store(kEntryAllocationIsForbiddenMarker,
33 std::memory_order_relaxed);
34
35 // When compacting, we can compute the number of unused segments at the end of
36 // the table and skip those during sweeping.
37 uint32_t start_of_evacuation_area =
38 space->start_of_evacuation_area_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
39 bool evacuation_was_successful = false;
40 if (space->IsCompacting()) {
41 if (space->CompactingWasAborted()) {
42 // Extract the original start_of_evacuation_area value so that the
43 // DCHECKs below and in TryResolveEvacuationEntryDuringSweeping work.
44 start_of_evacuation_area &= ~Space::kCompactionAbortedMarker;
45 } else {
46 evacuation_was_successful = true;
47 }
48 DCHECK(IsAligned(start_of_evacuation_area, kEntriesPerSegment));
49
50 space->StopCompacting();
51 }
52
53 // Sweep top to bottom and rebuild the freelist from newly dead and
54 // previously freed entries while also clearing the marking bit on live
55 // entries and resolving evacuation entries table when compacting the table.
56 // This way, the freelist ends up sorted by index which already makes the
57 // table somewhat self-compacting and is required for the compaction
58 // algorithm so that evacuated entries are evacuated to the start of a space.
59 // This method must run either on the mutator thread or while the mutator is
60 // stopped.
61 uint32_t current_freelist_head = 0;
62 uint32_t current_freelist_length = 0;
63 auto AddToFreelist = [&](uint32_t entry_index) {
64 at(entry_index).MakeFreelistEntry(current_freelist_head);
65 current_freelist_head = entry_index;
66 current_freelist_length++;
67 };
68
69 std::vector<Segment> segments_to_deallocate;
70 for (auto segment : base::Reversed(space->segments_)) {
71 bool segment_will_be_evacuated =
72 evacuation_was_successful &&
73 segment.first_entry() >= start_of_evacuation_area;
74 // Remember the state of the freelist before this segment in case this
75 // segment turns out to be completely empty and we deallocate it.
76 uint32_t previous_freelist_head = current_freelist_head;
77 uint32_t previous_freelist_length = current_freelist_length;
78
79 // Process every entry in this segment, again going top to bottom.
80 for (uint32_t i = segment.last_entry(); i >= segment.first_entry(); i--) {
81 auto payload = at(i).GetRawPayload();
82 if (payload.ContainsEvacuationEntry()) {
83 // Segments that will be evacuated cannot contain evacuation entries
84 // into which other entries would be evacuated.
85 DCHECK(!segment_will_be_evacuated);
86 // Resolve the evacuation entry: take the pointer to the handle from the
87 // evacuation entry, copy the entry to its new location, and finally
88 // update the handle to point to the new entry.
89 //
90 // While we now know that the entry being evacuated is free, we don't
91 // add it to (the start of) the freelist because that would immediately
92 // cause new fragmentation when the next entry is allocated. Instead, we
93 // assume that the segments out of which entries are evacuated will all
94 // be decommitted anyway after this loop, which is usually the case
95 // unless compaction was already aborted during marking.
96 //
97 // Note that the field may have been invalidated in the meantime (for
98 // example if the host object has been in-place converted to a
99 // different type of object). In that case, handle_location is invalid
100 // so we can't evacuate the old entry, but that is also not necessary
101 // since it is guaranteed to be dead.
102 bool entry_was_resolved = false;
103 Address handle_location =
104 payload.ExtractEvacuationEntryHandleLocation();
105 if (!space->FieldWasInvalidated(handle_location)) {
106 entry_was_resolved = TryResolveEvacuationEntryDuringSweeping(
107 i, reinterpret_cast<ExternalBufferHandle*>(handle_location),
108 start_of_evacuation_area);
109 }
110
111 if (entry_was_resolved) {
112 // The entry must now contain an external pointer and be unmarked as
113 // the entry that was evacuated must have been processed already (it
114 // is in an evacuated segment, which are processed first as they are
115 // at the end of the space). This will have cleared the marking bit.
116 DCHECK(at(i).GetRawPayload().ContainsExternalPointer());
117 DCHECK(!at(i).GetRawPayload().HasMarkBitSet());
118 } else {
119 // If the evacuation entry hasn't been resolved for whatever reason,
120 // we must clear it now as we would otherwise have a stale evacuation
121 // entry that we'd try to process again GC.
122 AddToFreelist(i);
123 }
124 } else if (!payload.HasMarkBitSet()) {
125 AddToFreelist(i);
126 } else {
127 auto new_payload = payload;
128 new_payload.ClearMarkBit();
129 at(i).SetRawPayload(new_payload);
130 }
131
132 // We must have resolved all evacuation entries. Otherwise, we'll try to
133 // process them again during the next GC, which would cause problems.
134 DCHECK(!at(i).HasEvacuationEntry());
135 }
136
137 // If a segment is completely empty, or if all live entries will be
138 // evacuated out of it at the end of this loop, free the segment.
139 // Note: for segments that will be evacuated, we could avoid building up a
140 // freelist, but it's probably not worth the effort.
141 uint32_t free_entries = current_freelist_length - previous_freelist_length;
142 bool segment_is_empty = free_entries == kEntriesPerSegment;
143 if (segment_is_empty || segment_will_be_evacuated) {
144 segments_to_deallocate.push_back(segment);
145 // Restore the state of the freelist before this segment.
146 current_freelist_head = previous_freelist_head;
147 current_freelist_length = previous_freelist_length;
148 }
149 }
150
151 // We cannot deallocate the segments during the above loop, so do it now.
152 for (auto segment : segments_to_deallocate) {
153 FreeTableSegment(segment);
154 space->segments_.erase(segment);
155 }
156
157 space->ClearInvalidatedFields();
158
159 FreelistHead new_freelist(current_freelist_head, current_freelist_length);
160 space->freelist_head_.store(new_freelist, std::memory_order_release);
161 DCHECK_EQ(space->freelist_length(), current_freelist_length);
162
163 uint32_t num_live_entries = space->capacity() - current_freelist_length;
164 return num_live_entries;
165}
166
167bool ExternalBufferTable::TryResolveEvacuationEntryDuringSweeping(
168 uint32_t new_index, ExternalBufferHandle* handle_location,
169 uint32_t start_of_evacuation_area) {
170 // We must have a valid handle here. If this fails, it might mean that an
171 // object with external pointers was in-place converted to another type of
172 // object without informing the external buffer table.
173 ExternalBufferHandle old_handle = *handle_location;
174 CHECK(IsValidHandle(old_handle));
175
176 uint32_t old_index = HandleToIndex(old_handle);
177 ExternalBufferHandle new_handle = IndexToHandle(new_index);
178
179 // It can happen that an external pointer field is cleared (set to the null
180 // handle) or even re-initialized between marking and sweeping. In both
181 // cases, compacting the entry is not necessary: if it has been cleared, the
182 // entry should remain cleared. If it has also been re-initialized, the new
183 // table entry must've been allocated at the front of the table, below the
184 // evacuation area (otherwise compaction would've been aborted).
185 if (old_index < start_of_evacuation_area) {
186 return false;
187 }
188
189 // The compaction algorithm always moves an entry from the evacuation area to
190 // the front of the table. These DCHECKs verify this invariant.
191 DCHECK_GE(old_index, start_of_evacuation_area);
192 DCHECK_LT(new_index, start_of_evacuation_area);
193 auto& new_entry = at(new_index);
194 at(old_index).MigrateInto(new_entry);
195 *handle_location = new_handle;
196 return true;
197}
198
199} // namespace internal
200} // namespace v8
201
202#endif // V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
